Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Initial commit: Action Item Extractor API

Built a Laravel application with the following features:
- Webhook endpoints to receive data (source, body format)
- Groq AI integration to extract actionable items from messages
- Database tracking with messages and action_items tables
- Sync endpoints for external apps to periodically fetch unsynced items
- Optional API key authentication for security

Key components:
- Models: Message and ActionItem with Eloquent relationships
- Services: GroqService for AI-powered action item extraction
- Controllers: WebhookController and SyncController
- Migrations: Database schema for messages and action items
- API routes with optional authentication middleware

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Add priority levels (low, medium, high) to action items

Features added:
- Database migration to add priority field with enum type
- Updated ActionItem model with priority field and scopes
- Enhanced GroqService to extract priority from AI analysis
- Updated WebhookController to store priority with each action item
- Enhanced SyncController to include priority in sync responses
- Added priority filtering to sync endpoint (?priority=high)
- Added priority statistics to sync stats endpoint

AI now analyzes urgency based on:
- HIGH: Urgent, time-sensitive, critical, important deadlines
- MEDIUM: Normal priority, routine tasks (default)
- LOW: Optional, nice-to-have, can be deferred

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Add sender field to track who messages came from

Features added:
- Database migration to add sender field to action_items table
- Updated ActionItem model to include sender in fillable fields
- Enhanced GroqService AI prompt to extract sender information from messages
- AI extracts sender from email headers, message content, or signatures
- Updated WebhookController to store sender with each action item
- Updated SyncController to include sender in sync responses

The AI now identifies who sent the message by looking for:
- Email "From:" headers or sender information
- Names or email addresses in the message body
- Person who made the request
- Returns null if sender cannot be determined

Example sync response now includes:
{
  "action": "Complete the report by Friday",
  "priority": "high",
  "sender": "Sarah Johnson",
  ...
}

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Improve AI prompt to reduce duplicate action items

Changes:
- Added CRITICAL RULES section emphasizing distinct items only
- Explicitly instructs AI to consolidate related statements into ONE action
- Added rule to ignore email signatures and formatting
- Clarified that only recipient-actionable items should be extracted
- Updated example to show consolidation (mail server + UAT = one item)
- Improved field descriptions for clarity

This fixes issue where emails like:
"Could you fix this issue on UAT? The mail server died."

Were being extracted as TWO items instead of ONE:
- Before: "Fix UAT issue" + "Fix mail server"
- After: "Fix the mail server issue on UAT environment"

The AI now better understands that multiple sentences can describe
the same underlying task and should be combined.

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Add newsletter and non-actionable content filtering to AI

Changes:
- Added explicit rules to IGNORE newsletters and marketing emails
- Added rule to IGNORE automated notifications and status updates
- Created "NOT actionable" section with clear examples
- AI now filters out promotional content and subscriptions
- Prevents extraction from purely informational messages

Types of content now ignored:
- Newsletters and marketing emails
- Automated notifications ("Your order has shipped")
- General announcements without specific requests
- Status updates that are purely informational
- Promotional content and advertisements
- Subscription confirmations and receipts

This significantly reduces noise by preventing the AI from
creating action items from non-productive email content.

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")
